annotation.TEXT: Okay, it looks like CI1, but with parakoopas replacing the Rhinos, I guess...
Here's where you'd find a hidden 1-up in the original, but in this game...
...Nothing! (The way HCBailly would say it.)
Whoa, geez! That was close! I've gotta be more careful.
Ah, there's our Fishing Boo representative! Hello, there! ...Oh, I guess there's more than one.

Wait, this isn't CI1... Oh, I think this is actually Forest of Illusion 4! But, since Lakitu is obviously too much for the NES to handle (Ignore SMB1 and SMB3-- They don't count.), we get yummy spike tops instead!
Whoa, what was that weird noise? It sounded like the sound effect of when I grab a cape feather, but I don't think I hit Select...
But, with that map music, who knows?
So, guess what I'm not going to do again! (Not intentionally, anyway...)
Alright, midpoint's in its proper spot here, unlike in FOREST OF ILLUSION 1!!!
Huh. Well, I guess I'm not opening that ? block without any Boo Blocks to support me here.
Ah, I figured this power up block was coming, so that's why I waited to use my reserve item.
Oh, and there's the goal. I'm actually a bit surprised that there was no bonus room in this level, but whatever.
Okay, the screen doesn't scroll up here. Well, I figured I'd check, since there's coins up there in the original.
Yep, though it's not exactly eager to get off its block...
So, next time... Well, who knows what this level will be? I'll guess Chocolate Island 3.
Whoa, I wish I could see those Eeries coming sooner...
I'm half-expecting one of these pipes to be a bonus room. (How do I "half-expect" something?)

Um, what... the...?! Ahahaha... Well! That's a first! I managed to crash the game! Also, it looks like we've got G. I. Anonymous (let's just call him Joe) hanging out in the upper-right corner there. Alright, give me a moment here, and I'll be right back...
There's that sound effect again, but it definitely couldn't have been from a Select button press this time. I bet cape spinning the spike top caused that sound somehow.
Bah! Just missed a multiple of 100 there...
Nuts. The spike tops are not flammable. (I can't say "inflammable", because apparently, "inflammable" means "flammable"!)
Whoa! How in the heck did I manage to get running speed there?!
Huh. I think I'm burning the piranha plants while they're in their pipes too, but you could also do that in the original game, so that's normal.
There's another P-switch that I don't know what it does. (Maybe it makes shoes for orphans?)
I wonder if Fishing Boo will show up...
Apparently, the game is okay with over a dozen sprites being on screen at once (although it may lag), but switching to my cape right after shooting a fireball is something it doesn't like!
There is still this Yoshi coin over here, but since they're useless, what's the point?
I think it's Chocolate!
Argh! I figured I'd end up getting Eerie ambushed like that...
There's those urchins, scrambling my score with their mere presence as usual...
Hello, and welcome back to Forest of Illusion 2! I'm back here to show off this lower path that I didn't show before, but I somehow managed to remember to this time!
Hey, a P-switch, but what does it do? I have no clue...
Now to begin what I assume will be Chocolate Island 1...
Oh, yeah. Cape spins one-shot Chucks. So guess what's gonna happen if they start playing dirty like in Forest of Illusion 1 again!
Okay, gimme that!
And is there a 1-up over here?
I guess this game can't exactly do moving holes though.

Okay, this level's done! ...Oh! And I just thought of what that P-switch probably did! I think it would've placed a platform under that ? block earlier. I'll have to check that when I get the chance... (I didn't think of that until after uploading this.)
What?! That thing hit me, even though I was small Mario on the ground?
Wow, that's a lot of Eeries... (Well, there were groups of five in the original game, too...)
To be continued...
Okay, pardon me for a moment, but my OCD is going to bother me to no end if I don't exit this level with my score at a multiple of 100...
Yes! Okay, there's a multiple of 100! Now I can just press Select to leave. Sorry about how long that took...
Can I maybe lure the first Eerie here out?
Well, that sucked. I'm going to try ducking in that situation next time.
Man, Yoshi's awesome...
Whoa, there, Chuck!
Demo count: 16
Okay, here's the question about the next ghost house: Is it Chocolate or Vanilla?
Yeah, I'll take the flower. It might come in handy.
Oh, that's cool! You can burn Lava Lotus and its projectiles!
Okay, what I did was I replayed my movie up to just before the crash happened, and resumed from there.
Outta the way, Boo.
ARGH!!! ...Except when that happens!
One nice thing about this game is that you don't have to wait a second between pausing/unpausing the game like in the original, so you can essentially "Start-spam" if you want!
No Boo Beams or Boo Chains or whatever you call them here. That's a plus, I think. There's the exit door, but what's to the right?
So, apparently a fireball can rebound backwards if it hits the corner of something just right. I wonder why that behavior was even programmed in like that?
Pop! I still love doing that!
Oh, that was weird. I think my fireball's graphics changed when I switched to the cape. Let's see that again...
Yeah, ducking lets me live! So, standing small Mario is taller than ducking small Mario? While that technically makes more sense, that's not how it was in the original game!
Hmm... Do I want that flower?
Alright, I'm outta here!
